activities.loc: Courtroom B, Third Floor - North Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James Gregory Sarr

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on January 5, 2023 at 08:30 am.

9:02 AM Defendant James Gregory Sarr appeared by video.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for James Gregory Sarr.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio in court for the State of Wisconsin. Motion for bond modification. Court denies motion. Scheduling order to be prepared.
Bail/bond hearing on August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

3:09 PM Prosecuting attorney Kyle Edward Johnson and intern Verity Altenberger appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Gregory Sarr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for James Gregory Sarr. Defendant pleads not guilty. Matter to be set. Court denies defense request for modification of bond.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:54 PM Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant James Gregory Sarr appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Refugio Cuco Longoria appeared by video for James Gregory Sarr. Kim Rau appeared in court by video for victim witness officer. Victim A.J.H. appeared in court by audio. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. Address verified. Victim addresses the court. Cash bond set of $400.00 with conditions: No contact directly or indirectly with victim A.J.H., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere except for one time trip with law enforcement to retrieve personal belongings. Maintain absolute sobriety. Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 3PM.
